meanings.definition: Failure to do something at the proper time, especially such delay as will bar a party from bringing a legal proceeding.
meanings.sent1: The plaintiff's case was dismissed due to laches in filing the lawsuit.
meanings.sent2: The court ruled against the defendant citing laches in presenting evidence.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer joked that the case was lost in the land of laches.
meanings.sent4: The concept of laches acted as a silent barrier to justice.
meanings.sent5: The word 'laches' echoed ominously in the courtroom.

meanings.sent1: The child suffered due to parental laches in providing care.
meanings.sent2: The company faced a lawsuit for laches in maintaining safety standards.
meanings.sent3: The garden withered under the laches of its neglectful owner.
meanings.sent4: The laches of the caretaker left the house in disarray.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of laches were evident in the abandoned project.
